front.title: An Extensible Markup Language Schema for Call Processing Language (CPL)

abstract.t: This document provides an Extensible Markup Language (XML) Schema forthe Call Processing Language (CPL). The original CPL specificationonly provides a Document Type Declaration (DTD) to describe thestructure of the language. Compared with XML DTDs, XML schemas havemany advantages such as performing stricter type checking, providingpre-defined data types and being able to derive new data types fromexisting ones. We further split the CPL schema into two parts, onecontains elements common to all the telecommunication entities, suchas user agents or presence agents. The other contains elements, suchas 'proxy', specifically for network servers.
